Good morning Harrisonburg! We're back again in your inbox, keeping you updated with what's happening in and around town. â˜•ï¸ï¸
In today's newsletter:
- Harrisonburg Auto Mall supports local children this holiday season
- Local initiative empowers immigrant students to achieve educational goals
- Harrisonburg teacher shares powerful military experiences
Also on today's calendar: Upbeat Downtown - Bill Pinkneyâ€™s Original Drifters and 9 more events.

- Thursday: Sun and areas of high clouds, with a high of 56 and low of 28 degrees.
- Friday: Partly sunny, temps: high: 59, low: 40.
- Saturday: Mostly cloudy, with a high of 61 and low of 54 degrees.
ðŸ“° News we're reading
1. Harrisonburg Auto Mall donation launches WHSV's 29th annual Toy Convoy (whsv.com) â€” Harrisonburg Auto Mall has made a generous $5,000 donation to kick off WHSV's 29th annual Toy Convoy, aimed at providing gifts for children in need. The event will run from December 1 to December 13, with donation sites across the region, including Harrisonburg.
2. Scholars Latino Initiative helps local immigrant students achieve college goals (dnronline.com) â€” The Scholars Latino Initiative hosted a fundraising dinner in Harrisonburg, highlighting the success of local immigrant students like Guadalupe Tenorio. The event raised over $38,000 to support Latino/a students pursuing higher education through scholarships and mentorship.
3. Harrisonburg teacher, Army vet endures Operation Just Cause, Desert Storm (whsv.com) â€” Christopher Sorber, a special education teacher at Harrisonburg High School, shares his experiences as a veteran of Operation Just Cause and Desert Storm. His journey from military service to teaching highlights the impact of his past on his current role in the Harrisonburg community.
4. Villanova Suffers 73-68 Loss to Princeton (villanova.com) â€” Villanova Wildcats will face the James Madison Dukes in Harrisonburg on November 16, 2025. This matchup follows Villanova's recent loss to Princeton, marking an important game for the Wildcats as they seek to improve their season record.
